intro: Gonolobus parviflorus, commonly known as the small-flowered go-nola, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, shaded habitats. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or greenish-white, and it produces small, hairy pods that contain seeds. Gonolobus parviflorus is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
